meanings.sent1: She upcast the ball into the air.
meanings.sent2: He always upcasts his fishing line to catch more fish.
meanings.sent3: The magician upcast the coin and made it disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter upcast a joyful atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The rocket upcast into the sky, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.sent1: The upcast of the stone startled the birds in the tree.
meanings.sent2: He caught the upcast of the ball effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected upcast of the paper airplane landed it on the roof.

meanings.sent5: The upcast of the net caught the falling leaves gracefully.
